results.title: Mr Strong
results.creator_credit: Terry Ward, Trevor Bond and Animated Flicks Films

Episode of Series “Mr Men”.
An animated adaptation of Roger Hargreaves book of the same title. Mr Strong, as his name suggests, demonstrates his physical prowess.

results.title: D.W. Griffith: father of film
results.creator_credit: David Gill, Kevin Brownlow, Channel Four and Thames Television
results.brief_description: A three part survey of the life and work of D.W. Griffith. His formative years in the theatre and at Biograph were followed by his major successes between 1915-1921: “The Birth of a nation”, “Broken blossoms”, “Way down east” and “Orphans of the storm”. The subsequently influential “Intolerance” was a critical and commercial failure prefiguring the failure, in the twenties, of “America”, “Isn’t life wonderful” and “The Sorrows of Satan” and later, of his neglected sound films, “Abraham Lincoln” and “The Struggle”. Brownlow and Gill make extensive use of colour-tinted extracts from his films and interviews with Lillian Gish, Blanche Sweet, Karl Brown and others. Narrated by Lindsay Anderson.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Gill, Kevin Brownlow, Channel Four and Thames Television

results.title: Jack be nimble
results.creator_credit: Garth Maxwell, Jonathan Dowling, Kelly Rogers, Essential Productions and New Zealand Film Commission
results.brief_description: This gothic horror/melodrama follows the entwined lives of Jack and Dora, deeply connected siblings who suffer lasting trauma after being separated from their parents, then from one another when they are sent to an orphanage and adopted by very different families. While Dora finds loving adoptive parents, the farming family Jack enters treat him brutally, eventually driving him to murder. Reunited with Dora as a teenager, Jack is still unable to let go of his idealised early childhood memories of their lives together with their mother and is consumed by a violent psychotic rage. Meanwhile his four feral sisters from his adoptive family are out to seek revenge for the death of their parents. Cast includes Alexis Arquette, Sara Smuts-Kennedy, Bruno Lawrence.

results.title: Mr Bump
results.creator_credit: Terry Ward, Trevor Bond and Animation Flicks Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mr Men”.
An animated film based on the ‘Mr. Men’ books by Roger Hargreaves. “Mr Bump” is the story of a little man who continuously bumps into things and causes accidents. But one day he finds a job that perfectly suits his unfortunate habit.

results.title: Jablonski
results.creator_credit: Reevan Dolgoy, Peter Jones and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A film on the life of Canadian concert pianist Marek Jablonski. He is seen at a concert debut in Spain, on a visit to his native Poland where he began his piano studies at the age of four, in Montreal playing to an audience of school children, and in Edmonton, where he lives. This is a memorable portrait of a man who lives for music. Note: no reference to music performed. Anecdotal interest only. Photography by Jean-Pierre Lachapelle.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Reevan Dolgoy, Peter Jones and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Jaara Nyilamum
results.creator_credit: Lou Bennett AM and Romaine Moreton
results.credit_line:
Dr Romaine Moreton (Goenpul Yagerabul Minjungbal Bundjalung) and Dr Lou Bennett AM (Dja Dja Wurrung, Yorta Yorta)

Single-channel video, 7.39 mins

Filmed and edited by Dr Romaine Moreton

Co-directed by Dr Romaine Moreton and Dr Lou Bennett AM

Jaara Nyilamum (song composition) Performed by Dr Lou Bennett AM and the Australian String Quartet

Composed by Dr Lou Bennett AM

Arranged by Iain Grandage

Produced by Stephen Snelleman

Engineered by Russell Thomson

ACMI Collection
results.brief_description:
“The making of “Jaara Nyilamum” (2021) evoked a stillness that restored us to full sensual immersion within Country, and from this place of rooted calmness, Country reaffirmed our Law is real. “Jaara Nyilamum” became most profound when we realised this was more than a film about ceremony, but was in fact, ceremony itself. Our challenge was to create a production model that aligned with our beliefs and centralised our Law, pushed back against monochronic time and engaged with the deep cycles of place, where we embraced Belonging as a process of constant renewal and Rematration.” – Dr Lou Bennett AM and Dr Romaine Moreton

Dr Lou Bennett is a performer, songwriter, musical and artistic director, composer, actor, soundscape designer and academic. Lou’s research project ‘Sovereign Language Rematriation Through Song Pedagogy’ focusses on the importance and relevance of Indigenous language retrieval, reclamation, and regeneration through the medium of the arts to enhance community health and wellbeing.

Dr Romaine Moreton is an artist, writer, performer, filmmaker, and her proposes an Indigenous philosophy of storytelling and embodied knowledge, with her work constantly drawing our attention back to the importance of the breath in Indigenous cultural practices.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dr Romaine Moreton (Goenpul Yagerabul Minjungbal Bundjalung), Dr Lou Bennett AM (Dja Dja Wurrung, Yorta Yorta)

Our challenge was to create a production model that aligned with our beliefs and centralised our Law, pushed back against monochronic time and engaged with the deep cycles of place, where we embraced Belonging as a process of constant renewal and Rematration.” – Dr Lou Bennett AM and Dr Romaine Moreton

Jaara Nyilamum (song composition) performed by Dr Lou Bennett AM and the Australian String Quartet. Composed by Dr Lou Bennett AM. Arranged by Iain Grandage. Produced by Stephen Snelleman. Engineered by Russell Thomson. ACMI Collection.

Filmed and edited by Dr Romaine Moreton

Co-directed by Dr Romaine Moreton and Dr Lou Bennett AM
